lead_paragraph: Nine of the 19 terrorists who hijacked four jetliners on Sept. 11 had been singled out for special scrutiny that morning under aviation-security guidelines, government officials said today, as they looked back sadly at what might have been. But because their baggage contained no explosives, the hijackers were allowed to board.

headline.main: 9 Hijackers Drew Scrutiny On Sept. 11, Officials Say

abstract: Government officials say 9 of 19 terrorists who hijacked four jets on Sept 11 were singled out for special scrutiny that morning under aviation-security guidelines, but that they were allowed to board because their baggage contained no explosives; say system prior to Sept 11 was geared to prevent bombs from being smuggled on board in luggage; details that are slowly emerging about Sept 11 suspicions and searches seem to tell story not of ineptitude but of security procedures overtaken by new terrorist tactics; for example, hijackers apparently wielded boxcutter knives of type that were then allowed on board but are now banned (M)
